Instruction: Combine the molasses, water, and yeast; let it sit for 5 minutes to activate the yeast.
Mix the shortening, sugar, and salt in a large bowl. Pour boiling water over them and stir in evaporated milk. Allow the mixture to cool until lukewarm. Add the yeast, water mixture, and beaten eggs.
Chill the dough in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to 1 hour after covering it with plastic wrap.
Roll out small portions of the dough until thin, then cut them into strips and make diamond shapes for frying.
Heat oil in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat until a thermometer inserted in the oil reads 360 degrees F (180 degrees C).
Fry the dough in batches until golden brown, about 3 to 5 minutes. Transfer to a paper towel-lined rack to cool slightly before dusting generously with confectioners' sugar.
Place any extra dough in plastic wrap and store it in the refrigerator where it can be kept for up to a week.
